intro: Boldoa paniculata, commonly known as the panicled boldo, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in panicles, which are followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and greenhouses for its foliage and unique fruiting structures.
